1.str2: A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

1.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
1.str2: To also, I too, but I. From kai and ego; so also the dative case kamoi, and accusative case kame and I, me.

1.str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.

1.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Spiritual. From pneuma; non-carnal, i.e. ethereal, or a spirit, or supernatural, regenerate, religious.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Fleshly, consisting of flesh, carnal. From sarx; similar to flesh, i.e. soft.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
From an obsolete particle ne- and epos; not speaking, i.e. An infant; figuratively, a simple-minded person, an immature Christian.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

2.str2: To cause to drink, give to drink; irrigate, water. From a derivative of the alternate of pino; to furnish drink, irrigate.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Food of any kind. From the base of bibrosko; food, especially articles allowed or forbidden by the Jewish law.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

(a) of time: still, yet, even now, (b) of degree: even, further, more, in addition. Perhaps akin to etos; 'yet, ' still.

For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.
From zeo; properly, heat, i.e. 'zeal' (figuratively, of God), or an enemy, malice).
Contention, strife, wrangling. Of uncertain affinity; a quarrel, i.e. wrangling.

Folly, absurdity, foolishness. From moros; silliness, i.e. Absurdity.

For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

19.parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
19.str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.

20.str2: Probably from the same as pale; anew, i.e. back, once more, or furthermore or on the other hand.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
